trans-unit.source: Indexing Media Files with Azure Media Indexer
trans-unit.target: Indexing Media Files with Azure Media Indexer

trans-unit.source: Azure Media Indexer enables you to make content of your media files searchable and to generate a full-text transcript for closed captioning and keywords.
trans-unit.target: Azure Media Indexer enables you to make content of your media files searchable and to generate a full-text transcript for closed captioning and keywords.

trans-unit.source: This topic shows how to use Media Indexer.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows how to use Media Indexer.

trans-unit.source: Indexing Media Files with Azure Media Indexer
trans-unit.target: Indexing Media Files with Azure Media Indexer

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.SELECTOR]
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.SELECTOR]

trans-unit.source: Portal
trans-unit.target: Portal

trans-unit.source: .NET
trans-unit.target: .NET

trans-unit.source: Azure Media Indexer enables you to make content of your media files searchable and to generate a full-text transcript for closed captioning and keywords.
trans-unit.target: Azure Media Indexer enables you to make content of your media files searchable and to generate a full-text transcript for closed captioning and keywords.

trans-unit.source: You can process one media file or multiple media files in a batch.
trans-unit.target: You can process one media file or multiple media files in a batch.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] When indexing content, make sure to use media files that have very clear speech (without background music, noise, effects, or microphone hiss).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] When indexing content, make sure to use media files that have very clear speech (without background music, noise, effects, or microphone hiss).

trans-unit.source: Some examples of appropriate content are: recorded meetings, lectures or presentations.
trans-unit.target: Some examples of appropriate content are: recorded meetings, lectures or presentations.

trans-unit.source: The following content might not be suitable for indexing: movies, TV shows, anything with mixed audio and sound effects, poorly recorded content with background noise (hiss).
trans-unit.target: The following content might not be suitable for indexing: movies, TV shows, anything with mixed audio and sound effects, poorly recorded content with background noise (hiss).

trans-unit.source: An indexing job generates four outputs to every indexing file:
trans-unit.target: An indexing job generates four outputs to every indexing file:

trans-unit.source: Closed caption file in SAMI format.
trans-unit.target: Closed caption file in SAMI format.

trans-unit.source: Closed caption file in Timed Text Markup Language (TTML) format.
trans-unit.target: Closed caption file in Timed Text Markup Language (TTML) format.

trans-unit.source: Both SAMI and TTML include a tag called Recognizability, which scores an indexing job based on how recognizable the speech in the source video is.
trans-unit.target: Both SAMI and TTML include a tag called Recognizability, which scores an indexing job based on how recognizable the speech in the source video is.

trans-unit.source: You can use the value of Recognizability to screen output files for usability.
trans-unit.target: You can use the value of Recognizability to screen output files for usability.

trans-unit.source: A low score would mean poor indexing results due to audio quality.
trans-unit.target: A low score would mean poor indexing results due to audio quality.

trans-unit.source: Keyword file (XML).
trans-unit.target: Keyword file (XML).

trans-unit.source: Audio indexing blob file (AIB) for use with SQL server.
trans-unit.target: Audio indexing blob file (AIB) for use with SQL server.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Using AIB Files with Azure Media Indexer and SQL Server](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2014/11/03/using-aib-files-with-azure-media-indexer-and-sql-server/).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Using AIB Files with Azure Media Indexer and SQL Server](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2014/11/03/using-aib-files-with-azure-media-indexer-and-sql-server/).

trans-unit.source: This topic shows how to create indexing jobs to **Index an asset** and **Index multiple files**.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows how to create indexing jobs to **Index an asset** and **Index multiple files**.

trans-unit.source: For the latest Azure Media Indexer updates, see [Media Services blogs](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/topics/media-services/).
trans-unit.target: For the latest Azure Media Indexer updates, see [Media Services blogs](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/topics/media-services/).

trans-unit.source: Using configuration and manifest files for indexing tasks
trans-unit.target: Using configuration and manifest files for indexing tasks

trans-unit.source: You can specify more details for your indexing tasks by using a task configuration.
trans-unit.target: You can specify more details for your indexing tasks by using a task configuration.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can specify which metadata to use for your media file.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can specify which metadata to use for your media file.

trans-unit.source: This metadata is used by the language engine to expand its vocabulary, and greatly improves the speech recognition accuracy.
trans-unit.target: This metadata is used by the language engine to expand its vocabulary, and greatly improves the speech recognition accuracy.

trans-unit.source: You can also process multiple media files at once by using a manifest file.
trans-unit.target: You can also process multiple media files at once by using a manifest file.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Task Preset for Azure Media Indexer](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn783454.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Task Preset for Azure Media Indexer](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn783454.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Index an asset
trans-unit.target: Index an asset

trans-unit.source: The following method uploads a media file as an asset and creates a job to index the asset.
trans-unit.target: The following method uploads a media file as an asset and creates a job to index the asset.

trans-unit.source: Note that if no configuration file is specified, the media file will be indexed with all default settings.
trans-unit.target: Note that if no configuration file is specified, the media file will be indexed with all default settings.

trans-unit.source: Output files
trans-unit.target: Output files

trans-unit.source: The indexing job generates the following output files.
trans-unit.target: The indexing job generates the following output files.

trans-unit.source: The files will be stored in the first output asset.
trans-unit.target: The files will be stored in the first output asset.

trans-unit.source: File name
trans-unit.target: File name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: InputFileName.aib
trans-unit.target: InputFileName.aib

trans-unit.source: Audio indexing blob file.
trans-unit.target: Audio indexing blob file.

trans-unit.source: Audio Indexing Blob (AIB) file is a binary file that can be searched in Microsoft SQL server using full text search.
trans-unit.target: Audio Indexing Blob (AIB) file is a binary file that can be searched in Microsoft SQL server using full text search.

trans-unit.source: The AIB file is more powerful than the simple caption files, because it contains alternatives for each word, allowing a much richer search experience.
trans-unit.target: The AIB file is more powerful than the simple caption files, because it contains alternatives for each word, allowing a much richer search experience.

trans-unit.source: It requires the installation of the Indexer SQL add-on on a machine running Microsoft SQL server 2008 or later.
trans-unit.target: It requires the installation of the Indexer SQL add-on on a machine running Microsoft SQL server 2008 or later.

trans-unit.source: Searching the AIB using Microsoft SQL server full text search provides more accurate search results than searching the closed caption files generated by WAMI.
trans-unit.target: Searching the AIB using Microsoft SQL server full text search provides more accurate search results than searching the closed caption files generated by WAMI.

trans-unit.source: This is because the AIB contains word alternatives which sound similar whereas the closed caption files contain the highest confidence word for each segment of the audio.
trans-unit.target: This is because the AIB contains word alternatives which sound similar whereas the closed caption files contain the highest confidence word for each segment of the audio.

trans-unit.source: If searching for spoken words is of upmost importance, then it is recommended to use the AIB In conjunction with Microsoft SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: If searching for spoken words is of upmost importance, then it is recommended to use the AIB In conjunction with Microsoft SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: To download the add-on, click Azure Media Indexer SQL Add-on.
trans-unit.target: To download the add-on, click Azure Media Indexer SQL Add-on.

trans-unit.source: It is also possible to utilize other search engines such as Apache Lucene/Solr to simply index the video based on the closed caption and keyword XML files, but this will result in less accurate search results.
trans-unit.target: It is also possible to utilize other search engines such as Apache Lucene/Solr to simply index the video based on the closed caption and keyword XML files, but this will result in less accurate search results.

trans-unit.source: InputFileName.smi
trans-unit.target: InputFileName.smi

trans-unit.source: InputFileName.ttml
trans-unit.target: InputFileName.ttml

trans-unit.source: Closed Caption (CC) files in SAMI and TTML formats.
trans-unit.target: Closed Caption (CC) files in SAMI and TTML formats.

trans-unit.source: They can be used to make audio and video files accessible to people with hearing disability.
trans-unit.target: They can be used to make audio and video files accessible to people with hearing disability.

trans-unit.source: Both SAMI and TTML include a tag called Recognizability which scores an indexing job based on how recognizable the speech in the source video is.
trans-unit.target: Both SAMI and TTML include a tag called Recognizability which scores an indexing job based on how recognizable the speech in the source video is.

trans-unit.source: You can use the value of Recognizability to screen output files for usability.
trans-unit.target: You can use the value of Recognizability to screen output files for usability.

trans-unit.source: A low score would mean poor indexing results due to audio quality.
trans-unit.target: A low score would mean poor indexing results due to audio quality.

trans-unit.source: InputFileName.kw.xml
trans-unit.target: InputFileName.kw.xml

trans-unit.source: Keyword file.
trans-unit.target: Keyword file.

trans-unit.source: Keyword file is an XML file that contains keywords extracted from the speech content, with frequency and offset information.
trans-unit.target: Keyword file is an XML file that contains keywords extracted from the speech content, with frequency and offset information.

trans-unit.source: The file can be used for a number of purposes, such as, to perform speech analytics, or exposed to search engines such as Bing, Google or Microsoft SharePoint to make the media files more discoverable, or used to deliver more relevant ads.
trans-unit.target: The file can be used for a number of purposes, such as, to perform speech analytics, or exposed to search engines such as Bing, Google or Microsoft SharePoint to make the media files more discoverable, or used to deliver more relevant ads.

trans-unit.source: If not all input media files are indexed successfully, the indexing job will fail with error code 4000.
trans-unit.target: If not all input media files are indexed successfully, the indexing job will fail with error code 4000.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Error codes](#error_codes).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Error codes](#error_codes).

trans-unit.source: Index multiple files
trans-unit.target: Index multiple files

trans-unit.source: The following method uploads multiple media files as an asset, and creates a job to index all these files in a batch.
trans-unit.target: The following method uploads multiple media files as an asset, and creates a job to index all these files in a batch.

trans-unit.source: A manifest file with the .lst extension is created and uploading into the asset.
trans-unit.target: A manifest file with the .lst extension is created and uploading into the asset.

trans-unit.source: The manifest file contains the list of all the asset files.
trans-unit.target: The manifest file contains the list of all the asset files.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Task Preset for Azure Media Indexer](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn783454.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Task Preset for Azure Media Indexer](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn783454.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Output files
trans-unit.target: Output files

trans-unit.source: When there are more than one input media files, WAMI will generate a manifest file for the job outputs, named ‘JobResult.txt’.
trans-unit.target: When there are more than one input media files, WAMI will generate a manifest file for the job outputs, named ‘JobResult.txt’.

trans-unit.source: For each input media file, the resulting AIB, SAMI, TTML, and keyword files, are sequentially numbered, as listed below.
trans-unit.target: For each input media file, the resulting AIB, SAMI, TTML, and keyword files, are sequentially numbered, as listed below.

trans-unit.source: For descriptions of output files, see [Output files](#output_files).
trans-unit.target: For descriptions of output files, see [Output files](#output_files).

trans-unit.source: File name
trans-unit.target: File name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: JobResult.txt
trans-unit.target: JobResult.txt

trans-unit.source: Output manifest
trans-unit.target: Output manifest

trans-unit.source: Below is the format of output manifest file (JobResult.txt).
trans-unit.target: Below is the format of output manifest file (JobResult.txt).

trans-unit.source: InputFile
trans-unit.target: InputFile

trans-unit.source: Alias
trans-unit.target: Alias

trans-unit.source: MediaLength
trans-unit.target: MediaLength

trans-unit.source: Error
trans-unit.target: Error

trans-unit.source: a.mp4
trans-unit.target: a.mp4

trans-unit.source: Media_1
trans-unit.target: Media_1

trans-unit.source: b.mp4
trans-unit.target: b.mp4

trans-unit.source: Media_2
trans-unit.target: Media_2

trans-unit.source: c.mp4
trans-unit.target: c.mp4

trans-unit.source: Media_3
trans-unit.target: Media_3

trans-unit.source: Each row represents one input media file:
trans-unit.target: Each row represents one input media file:

trans-unit.source: InputFile: asset file name or URL of the input media file.
trans-unit.target: InputFile: asset file name or URL of the input media file.

trans-unit.source: Alias: correspondent output file name.
trans-unit.target: Alias: correspondent output file name.

trans-unit.source: MediaLength: length of the input media file, in seconds.
trans-unit.target: MediaLength: length of the input media file, in seconds.

trans-unit.source: Can be 0 is error happened to this input.
trans-unit.target: Can be 0 is error happened to this input.

trans-unit.source: Error: indicates whether this media file is indexed successfully.
trans-unit.target: Error: indicates whether this media file is indexed successfully.

trans-unit.source: 0 for succeeded, otherwise failed.
trans-unit.target: 0 for succeeded, otherwise failed.

trans-unit.source: Please refer to Error Codes for concrete errors.
trans-unit.target: Please refer to Error Codes for concrete errors.

trans-unit.source: Media_1.aib
trans-unit.target: Media_1.aib

trans-unit.source: File #0 - Audio indexing blob file.
trans-unit.target: File #0 - Audio indexing blob file.

trans-unit.source: Media_1.smi
trans-unit.target: Media_1.smi

trans-unit.source: Media_1.ttml
trans-unit.target: Media_1.ttml

trans-unit.source: File #0 - Closed Caption (CC) files in SAMI and TTML formats.
trans-unit.target: File #0 - Closed Caption (CC) files in SAMI and TTML formats.

trans-unit.source: Media_1.kw.xml
trans-unit.target: Media_1.kw.xml

trans-unit.source: File #0 - Keyword file.
trans-unit.target: File #0 - Keyword file.

trans-unit.source: Media_2.aib
trans-unit.target: Media_2.aib

trans-unit.source: File #1 - Audio indexing blob file.
trans-unit.target: File #1 - Audio indexing blob file.

trans-unit.source: If not all input media files are indexed successfully, the indexing job will fail with error code 4000.
trans-unit.target: If not all input media files are indexed successfully, the indexing job will fail with error code 4000.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Error codes](#error_codes).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Error codes](#error_codes).

trans-unit.source: Partially Succeeded Job
trans-unit.target: Partially Succeeded Job

trans-unit.source: If not all input media files are indexed successfully, the indexing job will fail with error code 4000.
trans-unit.target: If not all input media files are indexed successfully, the indexing job will fail with error code 4000.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Error codes](#error_codes).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Error codes](#error_codes).

trans-unit.source: The same outputs (as succeeded jobs) are generated.
trans-unit.target: The same outputs (as succeeded jobs) are generated.

trans-unit.source: You can refer to the output manifest file to find out which input files are failed, according to the Error column values.
trans-unit.target: You can refer to the output manifest file to find out which input files are failed, according to the Error column values.

trans-unit.source: For input files that are failed, the resulting AIB, SAMI, TTML, and keyword files will NOT be generated.
trans-unit.target: For input files that are failed, the resulting AIB, SAMI, TTML, and keyword files will NOT be generated.
